Notes: Polite; includes order #. Easy to automate with tracking macro + reassurance.
Required Workflow:
Shipping Delay, Neutral Status Check

WISMO Workflow

1. Check the customer‚Äôs orders.

   1. If no order found, ask for the order ID and check again.

2. Give the current status update.

   1. If unfulfilled, say it has not shipped yet.
   2. If fulfilled and in transit, say it is on the way.
   3. If delivered, say it is marked delivered.

3. If it is still in transit, set the wait promise based on contact day.

   1. Customer contacts Mon to Wed: ask them to wait until Friday. If not delivered by then, offer a free resend.
   2. Customer contacts Thu to Sun: ask them to wait until early next week. If not delivered by then, offer a free resend.

4. If customer asks for tracking, share the tracking link.

5. If they reply after the promised date and it is still not delivered, escalate the ticket to let the human agent can process resend.
Example Summaries: "Order #43189 shows ‚Äòin transit‚Äô for 10 days. Any update?" "Hi, just curious when my BuzzPatch will arrive to Toronto." "Can you confirm the estimated delivery date? Thanks!"

Notes: Needs apology, photo request, and re‚Äëshipment. Offer freebie for high LTV.
Required Workflow:
Wrong or Missing Item in Parcel Process

1. Check the customer‚Äôs order, items purchased, and what was fulfilled.

2. Ask what happened so you can pick the right fix.

   1. Missing item
   2. Wrong item received

3. Request photos to confirm and speed things up.

   1. To get this sorted fast, could you send a photo of the items you received?
   2. If there is a packing slip, ask for a photo of that too.
   3. If possible, ask for a photo of the outside shipping label on the box.

4. Offer the fastest resolution first.

   1. Offer a free reship of the missing item or the correct item.
   2. If they asked for a refund, explain you can resend it immediately, and it‚Äôs usually faster than a refund.

5. If they do not want a reship, offer store credit first.

   1. Offer store credit for the item value, plus a small bonus if your policy allows, for example 10%.
   2. If they accept, issue the store credit and tag: ‚ÄúWrong or Missing, Store Credit Issued‚Äù.

6. If they decline store credit, refund in cash.

   1. Refund to the original payment method.
   2. Tag: ‚ÄúWrong or Missing, Cash Refund Issued‚Äù.

7. Close the loop.

   1. If reship, escalate the ticket to support, so the support members can resend the order.
   2. If store credit, confirm the credit amount and that it is available immediately at checkout.
   3. If cash refund, confirm the amount and the expected processing time.
Example Summaries: "Got Zen stickers instead of Focus‚Äîkids need them for school, help!" "My package arrived with only 2 of the 3 packs I paid for." "Received the pet collar but the tick stickers are missing."

Notes: Empathy + usage advice. Refund or upgrade option.
Required Workflow:
Product Issue Process: No Effect

1. Check the customer‚Äôs order, product, and status.

2. Ask why it felt like ‚Äúno effect‚Äù so you don‚Äôt apply the wrong fix.

   1. Ask the goal: falling asleep, staying asleep, stress, or something else.
   2. Ask usage: how many, what time, and for how many nights.

3. Route based on what you learn.

   1. If usage is off (too late, inconsistent, too short duration), share the correct usage and ask them to try for 3 nights.
   2. If the product is a mismatch for their goal, offer a better fit product switch.

4. If the customer is still disappointed after guidance:

   1. Offer store credit with a 10% bonus instead of cash refund.
   2. If they accept, issue credit and tag: ‚ÄúNo Effect ‚Äì Recovered‚Äù.
   3. If they decline, refund in cash to the original payment method and tag: ‚ÄúNo Effect ‚Äì Cash Refund‚Äù.
Example Summaries: "Kids still getting bitten even with 2 stickers on." "Focus patches aren‚Äôt helping my son concentrate." "Itch relief patch did nothing for the sting."

Notes: Linked to shipping/product issues. Refund flow.
Required Workflow:
Refund Request Standard Process

1. Check the customer‚Äôs order details and status.
2. Ask for the reason for the refund request.

   1. If the reason is product didn‚Äôt meet expectations:

      1. Ask one quick follow up to identify the cause: falling asleep, staying asleep, comfort, taste, or no effect etc.
      2. Share the correct usage tip based on the cause.
      3. Offer a better fit swap option.
      4. If the customer still wants a refund, offer store credit with a 10% bonus instead of cash refund.
      5. If accepted, issue store credit and log the outcome with a tag.

   2. If the reason is shipping delay:

      1. If the customer contacts you on Monday or Tuesday, ask if they are okay waiting until Friday. If it is not delivered by then, offer a free replacement.
      2. If the customer contacts you on Wednesday through Friday, ask if they are okay waiting until early next week. If it is not delivered by then, offer a free replacement.
      3. If the customer refuses to wait, offer a free replacement immediately, then escalate the ticket so we can review. Tell customers this: "Hey, I'm looping Monica, who is our Head of CS, she'll take it from there."

   3. If the reason is damaged or wrong item:

      1. Offer a free replacement or store credit.
      2. If the customer chooses replacement, escalete the ticket so we can review.
      3. If the customer chooses store credit, issue credit with a small bonus if allowed.

   4. If the reason is changed mind:

      1. If unfulfilled, cancel the order and log the action by adding tags.
      2. If fulfilled, offer store credit with a small bonus before processing a cash refund.
Example Summaries: "Please refund order #51234; product arrived too late." "Want my money back‚Äîstickers don‚Äôt repel mosquitoes as promised." "Returning unused packs for a full refund, thanks."

Notes: Time‚Äësensitive. Can be automated if <2 h.
Required Workflow:
Order Cancellation Process

1. Check the customer‚Äôs orders.
2. Ask for the reason for the cancellation.

   1. If the reason is a shipping delay:

      1. If the customer contacts you on Monday or Tuesday, ask if they are okay waiting until Friday. If it is not delivered by then, you can cancel it.
      2. If the customer contacts you on Wednesday through Friday, ask if they are okay waiting until early next week.
   2. If the reason is that the order was placed accidentally, cancel the order and add a tag to log the action.


Order Update Shipping Address

1. If a customer wants to update their shipping address:

   1. Check whether they placed the order on the same date, and make sure the order status is unfulfilled.
   2. If true, update the shipping address and tag the order with ‚Äúcustomer verified address.‚Äù
2. If you find any error, escalate the ticket to Monica, saying: ‚ÄúTo make sure you get the right response, I‚Äôm looping in Monica, who is our Head of CS. She‚Äôll take the conversation from there.‚Äù
Example Summaries: "Accidentally ordered twice‚Äîplease cancel one." "Realised I used wrong address‚Äîcancel so I can reorder." "Need to cancel order #67890 before it ships, thanks."

Notes: Fix fast. Often double‚Äëcharge or skip fail.
Required Workflow:
Subscription Process

1. Check the subscription status on the Subscription Platform.
2. Ask for the reason.

   1. If the reason is ‚Äútoo many on hand right now‚Äù:
      1. Offer to skip the next order instead. If they confirm, skip the next order for 1 month.
      2. If they don‚Äôt confirm, offer a 20% discount on their next two orders.
      3. If they still want to cancel, cancel the subscription.
   2. If the reason is ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt like the product quality‚Äù:
      1. Offer to swap to a different product. If they confirm, process the swap.
      2. If they don‚Äôt confirm, cancel the subscription.
Example Summaries: "I cancelled but still got charged‚Äîrefund please." "Need to pause my monthly BuzzPatch delivery for August." "Credit card changed‚Äîhow do I update details?"

Required Workflow:
Discount Code Problems

1. If a client wants to reclaim the code or is experiencing that the code is not valid, create a one-time discount code for that specific client. You can create a one-time 10% discount code with a 48-hour lifespan.

2. After you create the code, send it to the customer and let them know it is valid for 48 hours.

3. Only create one discount code for the customer.
Example Summaries: "WELCOME10 code says invalid at checkout." "Forgot to apply discount‚Äîcan you refund the difference?" "App won‚Äôt accept my loyalty points."
